issue.title: Builds fails with `exited with code 1` with no apparent error

labels.name: os-linux
labels.description: Linux OS (any supported distro)

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

issue.body:
Found in an unrelated `main` PR: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/76846

- Queue: `coreclr Pri0 Runtime Tests Run Linux arm checked`
- Step: `Generate CORE_ROOT`
- Job results: https://dev.azure.com/dnceng-public/public/_build/results?buildId=47155&view=logs&j=5875517b-40f2-5b27-5b45-8b8aba144595&t=686c3acf-ada3-5f7b-de39-286d415bf9d5
- Log output:
```
Creating MsbuildDebugLogsDir: /__w/1/s/artifacts/log/MsbuildDebugLogs
Building tests via "/__w/1/s/eng/common/msbuild.sh"  --warnAsError false /__w/1/s/src/tests/build.proj /t:TestBuild /p:TargetArchitecture=arm /p:Configuration=Checked /p:TargetOS=Linux /nodeReuse:false    /maxcpucount "/flp:Verbosity=normal;LogFile=/__w/1/s/artifacts/log/Layout.Linux.arm.Checked.log" "/flp1:WarningsOnly;LogFile=/__w/1/s/artifacts/log/Layout.Linux.arm.Checked.wrn" "/flp2:ErrorsOnly;LogFile=/__w/1/s/artifacts/log/Layout.Linux.arm.Checked.err" "/bl:/__w/1/s/artifacts/log/Layout.Linux.arm.Checked.binlog" /p:NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS=4 /p:LibrariesConfiguration=Release /p:CrossBuild=true
/__w/1/s/.dotnet/sdk/7.0.100-rc.1.22431.12/MSBuild.dll /nologo -maxcpucount /m /maxcpucount -verbosity:m /v:minimal /bl:/__w/1/s/artifacts/log/Layout.Linux.arm.Checked.binlog /clp:Summary /flp1:WarningsOnly;LogFile=/__w/1/s/artifacts/log/Layout.Linux.arm.Checked.wrn /flp2:ErrorsOnly;LogFile=/__w/1/s/artifacts/log/Layout.Linux.arm.Checked.err /flp:Verbosity=normal;LogFile=/__w/1/s/artifacts/log/Layout.Linux.arm.Checked.log /nr:true /nodeReuse:false /p:TreatWarningsAsErrors=false /p:ContinuousIntegrationBuild=false /p:TargetArchitecture=arm /p:Configuration=Checked /p:TargetOS=Linux /p:NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS=4 /p:LibrariesConfiguration=Release /p:CrossBuild=true /t:TestBuild /__w/1/s/src/tests/build.proj
  [17:13:59.22] Restoring all packages...
    Determining projects to restore...
    All projects are up-to-date for restore.
    Determining projects to restore...
/__w/1/s/src/tests/build.proj(437,5): error MSB3073: The command ""/__w/1/s/.dotnet/dotnet" restore -r linux-arm Common/test_dependencies/test_dependencies.csproj  /p:SetTFMForRestore=true /p:TargetOS=Linux /p:TargetArchitecture=arm /p:Configuration=Checked /p:CrossBuild=true" exited with code 1.

Build FAILED.
```

issue.title: Don't use IsMatchingConst in Tier0

labels.name: area-CodeGen-coreclr
labels.description: CLR JIT compiler in src/coreclr/src/jit and related components such as SuperPMI

issue.body: According to flamegraphs, JIT spends quite a lot of time inside LSRA for Tier0. I noticed `isMatchingConstant` in the traces while in code it's already disabled for tier0 but still invoked.

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @JulieLeeMSFT, @jakobbotsch See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
According to flamegraphs, JIT spends quite a lot of time inside LSRA for Tier0. I noticed `isMatchingConstant` in the traces while in code it's already disabled for tier0 but still invoked.
Author: EgorBo
Assignees: EgorBo
Labels: `area-CodeGen-coreclr`
Milestone: -

issue.title: Navisworks.Freedom version 4.0.19.0

labels.name: Validation-Unattended-Failed
labels.description: During installation testing the installer was blocked on user input and no switches were provided.

issue.body:
- [x] Have you signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://cla.opensource.microsoft.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs)?
- [x] Have you checked that there aren't other open [pull requests](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs/pulls) for the same manifest update/change?
- [x] Have you [validated](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs/blob/master/AUTHORING_MANIFESTS.md#validation) your manifest locally with `winget validate --manifest <path>`?
- [x] Have you tested your manifest locally with `winget install --manifest <path>`?
- [x] Does your manifest conform to the [1.2 schema](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs/tree/master/doc/manifest/schema/1.2.0)?

Note: `<path>` is the name of the directory containing the manifest you're submitting.

-----


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs/pull/87542)

comment.body:
Hello @daraghk86,

During installation testing, this application failed to install without user input. Did you forget to add Silent or SilentWithProgress switches?

This can also happen when a dependency is missing. You can test with https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs#test-your-manifest.

Please investigate a fix and resubmit the Pull Request.

You may also try using the [Windows Package Manager Manifest Creator](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-create) to determine the proper installer type. If the installer type is MSIX, MSI, or a known installer technology like NullSoft, Inno, etc. the wingetcreate tool can detect them and the winget client will know what switches to pass. If it's a .exe installer of an unknown type, you will need to search to determine the proper switches for Silent and SilentWithProgress.

Template: msftbot/validationError/installation/unattended

issue.title: inconsistent text under remarks

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

labels.name: Pri3
labels.description: Indicates issues/PRs that are low priority

issue.body:
https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/blob/main/xml/Microsoft.SqlServer.Server/SqlUserDefinedAggregateAttribute.xml

from article
Remarks
Reserved for future use. This property is not currently used by the query processor: order is currently not guaranteed.

Incorrectly setting this property can result in incorrect query results. This property is not an optimizer hint; it affects the plan selected and the results returned by the query.

The default value for this property is false.

A property cannot be "not in use" and at the same time have an effect on the results. That would imply it is used.

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @cheenamalhotra, @david-engel See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/blob/main/xml/Microsoft.SqlServer.Server/SqlUserDefinedAggregateAttribute.xml from article Remarks Reserved for future use. This property is not currently used by the query processor: order is currently not guaranteed. Incorrectly setting this property can result in incorrect query results. This property is not an optimizer hint; it affects the plan selected and the results returned by the query. The default value for this property is false. A property cannot be "not in use" and at the same time have an effect on the results. That would imply it is used.

issue.title: [Feature request] Add a generic pagination component to use with other components

labels.name: Needs: Author Feedback
labels.description: Issue needs response from issue author

issue.body: # Proposal: Add a pagination component `` to work with other components ## Description Currently , we have a bunch of amazing components like Agenda, People, Person, Tasks , Get etc. We are able to limit results in some of these components using `max-pages` property. But its an either/or scenario. We can either limit the results or get all results. There is no way, AFAIK, to display data in a paged manner. Please correct me if I am wrong. ## Rationale By addition of this feature, we can limit the amount of data over the wire. It will also open up possibilities to display data in a paged manner instead of limiting the result set. For example, show me the top 10 calendar events. Then I click on next button, it fetches me the next 10 events. Same could be the case with users. Show me 100 users, then click on next button, show me the next 100 users etc. ## Preferred Solution Something like this: ``` { //do something, like get next N items }} limiterIcon={"Emoji12"} /> ``` Basically a connection between , say `mgt-get` or `mgt-agenda` or `mgt-tasks` and `mgt-pagination` components so that we can display this data from Graph in a paged manner. ## Additional Context Something similar to PnP SPFx controls - https://pnp.github.io/sp-dev-fx-controls-react/controls/Pagination/ https://microsoft-search.github.io/pnp-modern-search/usage/search-results/common/paging/ We can also add `show-pagination` property to existing components ( Agenda, Tasks, People etc.) to display data in a paged manner. Please let me know if you need more information or anything else.

issue.title: [API Proposal]: Add 2 more constructors to ConcurrentDictionary class

labels.name: api-suggestion
labels.description: Early API idea and discussion, it is NOT ready for implementation

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @dotnet/area-system-collections See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
### Background and motivation The `System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary` type has the following constructor (among others) that has just one parameter, which allows to specify the initial dictionary capacity to help avoid reallocations and copying when the storage needs to grow: ```csharp public Dictionary (int capacity); ``` For some reason, if you want to use `System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary` and set the initial capacity, you need to use a constructor with 2 parameters: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity); ``` There is no constructor that only accepts `int capacity`. I always must specify this arcane `concurrencyLevel` parameter. We, as the framework users, don't know the default value of this parameter, because it is not documented, and we surely can assume that it may change in the future. Besides, we should not to worry about properly determining a correct concurrency level, when we only want to set the capacity. If we're unfortunate enough to specify a constant value there, the program will have the concurrency set improperly when running on a different machine - e.g. may have too many locks on only couple of cores, or not enough locks on a powerful machine. To fix the above and as an added benefit to make the API more consistent with `Dictionary` I propose to add two more constructors as shown below. ### API Proposal ```csharp namespace System.Collections.Concurrent; public class ConcurrentDictionary { public ConcurrentDictionary (int capacity); public ConcurrentDictionary (int capacity, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); } ``` ### API Usage ```csharp // I know that there will be more or less 1000 dictionary items and want to reduce reallocations/copying. // According to the docs, "the capacity should not be divisible by a small prime number", hence a prime here. var dict = new ConcurrentDictionary(1009); // Use the dictionary as usual. ``` ### Alternative Designs Alternative is to use the existing constructors: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity); public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); ``` and maintain the concurrency level at our side, perhaps providing there `Environment.ProcessorCount`. It is just extraneous and not clear. ### Risks This addition does not create a breaking change and is a really simple modification. There's no added maintenance burden, as the implicit concurrency level value is already used in some constructors (such as the default one). I assume that the constructors weren't implemented so far, because there are others taking just one `int` value, such as this: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable> collection, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); ``` and the API designer may had thought that it might have been confusing to have the first parameter sometimes meaning concurrency level, and other times the capacity. This is unwarranted, and benefits far outweigh this risk.
Author: Hermholtz
Assignees: -
Labels: `api-suggestion`, `area-System.Collections`, `untriaged`
Milestone: -

issue.title: [File Locksmith] does not identify locks from other logged in users

labels.name: Issue-Bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Needs-Triage
labels.description: For issues raised to be triaged and prioritized by internal Microsoft teams

issue.body:
### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.64.0

### Installation method

PowerToys auto-update

### Running as admin

Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

File Locksmith

### Steps to reproduce

 - logged in as user1
 - opened a PowerPoint file from a flash drive
 - verified I get error when trying to eject flash drive
 - stayed logged in as user1 and logged in as user2
 - tried to eject flash drive and got error saying device is in use (as expected)
 - right-clicked powerpoint file on flash drive currently opened by user1
 - chose "What's using this file?"
 - "no results"

### ✔️ Expected Behavior

when checking "What's using this file?", it should report that the file is locked by user1

### ❌ Actual Behavior

I get "no results" when logged in as user2. File Locksmith is not finding the file lock in place by user1

When I am on as user1 and use File Locksmith, and click the chevron for more details, it identifies that the user of the locked file is me (user1), which is why I assumed it would identify user1 as having a lock on the file when logged on as user2.

### Other Software

_No response_

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones, FancyZones Editor

I have no idea why but on my Desktop it's not possible anymore to switch between my Fancyzone configurated layouts with the key combination Strg + Win + alt + Hotkey. I changed nothing but from one moment to another it didn't work anymore. No Idea how to fix this. Please help.

Strg + Win + alt + Hotkey changes between the configured Layouts

### ❌ Actual Behavior

Strg + Win + alt + Hotkey leads to no reaction of the system

issue.title: Match Application Insights schema when exporting

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: analytics
labels.description: Related to App Center's analytics service

labels.name: reviewed-DRI
labels.description: Reviewed by DRI

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
Custom events are exported to Application Insights (when connected via Export) but the data that reaches Application Insights does not match the schema used.  The mismatch results in more data being sent, which is invalid for non-mobile, and the custom event data in a sub-dictionary unlike AI.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
There are no exposed alternative solutions, the SDK needs modification.

**Additional context**
We are gathering analytics for Windows print drivers and desktop applications.  The use of the AppCenter SDK is to add analytics to the macOS print drivers. The Windows group is using the Microsoft provided Application Insights SDK and the data format it sends is the basis for the data queries already created.

The macOS AppCenter SDK, when exporting to Application Insights, uses a different schema than AI does.  The custom event data from AppCenter is put in root:customDimensions:properties and the custom event data from AI is in root:customDimensions.

In addition, AppCenter sends along fields that are mobile specific and/or empty.  We are sending data from a background process so screen size is always 0x0, is this useful data to send?  The Windows users generate 2 GB of data each day so sending non-useful fields is just wasted bytes.

Attached are 2 screenshots showing the difference in data between macOS and Windows.
![macos](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47667503/53810881-f64b9880-3f25-11e9-97c9-9f9571060cfd.png)
![windows](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47667503/53810882-f64b9880-3f25-11e9-9c14-b7b61b4aa90b.png)

issue.title: Improve shadow DOM support (visualizations & tab stops automation)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: status: needs author feedback
labels.description: This issue requires additional information from the issue author.

labels.name: status: no recent activity
labels.description: This issue requires additional information from the author, but hasn't been updated recently.

labels.name: status: resolved
labels.description: This issue has been merged into main and deployed to canary.

issue.body:
This issue tracks tasks that would holistically improve support of shadow DOM in Accessibility Insights. We are pretty close but have some small improvements to make.

I made a tracking issue because it feels like there could be other areas of the tool I'm forgetting. For example, any fixes should also check assessment behavior. Happy to restructure or break out as requested.

At the moment, everything below is related to open (not closed) shadow DOM support.

### Current status
Automated checks supports open shadow DOM ([see FAQ](https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/web/reference/faq/#are-automated-checks-compatible-with-shadow-dom) added in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/issues/3768). We do not support closed Shadow DOM (expected). This is consistent with `axe-core`, which [added native open shadow DOM support in v3.0](https://github.com/dequelabs/axe-core/blob/develop/doc/developer-guide.md#axe-developer-guide).

Running automated checks on a webpage with open shadow elements results in a reasonable list of errors and automated report.

### Improvements

#### Visualization
Accessibility Insights for Web does not draw highlight boxes around elements inside open shadow DOMs. 

One example of this behavior for headings is here: https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/issues/5126 In this case, no highlight box is drawn at all.

`axe-core` provides a canonical way to find out whether a resulting node is in a shadow DOM: 
> If the item in the Array is an Array of strings, then it points to an element in a shadow DOM and each item (except the n-1th) in this array is a selector to a DOM element with a shadow DOM. The last element in the array points to the final shadow DOM node.

Our code (one example in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/blob/20a946b8d4bbf8fe098c1dddbde1e4348c417d91/src/injected/visualization/highlight-box-drawer.ts#L16) does not leverage this fact.

If we run automated checks on an element inside shadow DOM, the shadow root is highlighted instead of the child element.

#### Tab stops automation
Testing tab stops on pages with open shadow DOMs can have unexpected effects (see details & proposed fix in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/pull/5463#issuecomment-1122915346):
- Our tab-stop-listening code identifies the shadow root rather than a child node when focused. Therefore we produce many "keyboard trap" errors.
- I plan to merge the Tabbable update without opting in to shadow DOM support. We should opt into support separately and together with the other changes in this section.

### Examples to test against

This [CodePen](https://codepen.io/karansin/full/abqZXaL) is a modified version of shadow-doms.html Dan added in our repo.

### other details
Version 2.32.0
Chrome Version 101.0.4951.54 (Official Build) (32-bit)
Windows 19044.1645

issue.body:
<!-- 
Please provide a succinct description of the issue. Please make an effort to fill in the all the sections below or we may close your issue for being low quality. 
-->

#### Investigative information


- Timestamp: 2022-15-06
- Function App version: 4.3.2.2
- Invocation ID: N/A
- Region: North Europe

<!--

Provide an invocation id per Function. See the [wiki](https://github.com/Azure/azure-webjobs-sdk-script/wiki/Sharing-Your-Function-App-name-privately) for more details.

Provide the steps required to reproduce the problem:

<!--
Example: 

1. Step A
2. Step B
-->

1. Create an Azure function on linux consumption plan with dotnet 6
2. Run `az functionapp config show`, linuxFxVersion is set to "DOTNET|6.0"
3. Run `az functionapp config set` to set the version to `DOCKER|mcr.microsoft.com/azure-functions/mesh:4.5.2` (as described [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/set-runtime-version?tabs=azurecli#manual-version-updates-on-linux))
4. Run `az functionapp config show`, linuxFxVersion is set to the new value

Unknown

issue.title: [BUG] Unable to deploy new AKS cluster with windows nodes using bicep, since docker is no longer supported
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Bicep deployment fails when creating a aks cluster with a windows node pool. Windows nodepools no longer support docker (since kubernetes version 1.24). It is not possible to deploy a new nodepool using Bicep because setting the customheader is not possible.

Since bicep is a layer above ARM, it probably also fails when using plain ARM.

**To Reproduce**
Deploy a AKS cluster using Bicep, with the follwing windows nodepool. Notice the error that the custom header is not supported. Without aksCustomHeaders you will the error that docker is no longer supported.
```
      {
        name: 'akswin1'
        orchestratorVersion: 1.24.3
        count: 2
        mode: 'User'
        osType: 'Windows'
        type: 'VirtualMachineScaleSets'
        vmSize: windowsPoolVmSize
        enableFIPS:   false
        osDiskSizeGB: 128
        aksCustomHeaders: 'WindowsContainerRuntime=containerd'
      }
```

**Expected behavior**
Since containerd is the default, the cluster should deploy without error. The validation seems incorrect to me.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Bicep version 0.11.1 
 - CLI Version 2.38.0
 - Kubernetes version 1.24.3

**Additional context**
Upgrading an existing cluster works fine. The workaround is to deploy an older version of kubernetes first. This will default to containerd. Then upgrade to 1.24.3. This only works until version 1.23 is supported.

issue.title: Vectorize String.Equals for OrdinalIgnoreCase

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @dotnet/area-system-globalization See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
I tried to keep it simple so no AVX fallback + scalar path for trailing elements. Benchmark: ```csharp [Benchmark] [ArgumentsSource(nameof(TestData))] public bool EqualsIgnoreCase(string s1, string s2) => s1.Equals(s2, StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase); public static IEnumerable TestData() { yield return new object[] { @"Hi!", // 3 chars (to make sure overhead is not big) @"HI!", }; yield return new object[] { @"hello!!!", // 8 chars (switches to SIMD) @"HELLO!!!", }; yield return new object[] { @"hello world", // 11 chars (1 simd + trailing elements) @"HELLO WORLD", }; yield return new object[] { @"C:\prj\runtime-main\src\coreclr\CMakeLists.txt", @"C:\prj\runtime-main\src\CORECLR\CMakeLists.txt", }; yield return new object[] { @"Good bug reports make it easier for maintainers to verify and root cause the underlying problem. The better a bug report, the faster the problem will be resolved. Ideally, a bug report should contain the following information:", // 226 chars @"GOOD bug reports make it easier for maintainers to verify and root cause the underlying problem. The better a bug report, the faster the problem will be resolved. Ideally, a bug report should contain the following information:", }; } ``` | Method | Toolchain | s1 | s2 | Mean | |----------------- |---------------------------- |--------------------- |--------------------- |----------:| | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | Hi! | HI! | 2.940 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | Hi! | HI! | 2.901 ns | | | | | | | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | hello!!! | HELLO!!! | 4.898 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | hello!!! | HELLO!!! | 4.829 ns | | | | | | | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | hello world | HELLO WORLD | 5.880 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | hello world | HELLO WORLD | 6.143 ns | | | | | | | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | C:\pr(...)s.txt [46] | C:\pr(...)s.txt [46] | 11.422 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | C:\pr(...)s.txt [46] | C:\pr(...)s.txt [46] | 19.049 ns | | | | | | | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | Good(...)ion: [226] | GOOD(...)ion: [226] | 40.289 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | Good(...)ion: [226] | GOOD(...)ion: [226] | 86.035 ns | I expect better difference on ARM64 where the scalar (SWAR) path suffers from 64bit constants everywhere.

issue.title: Stopwatch.GetTimestamp() doesn't take into account sleep time on Unix

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

issue.body:
### Description

`Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` doesn't take into account suspend/sleep time on Unix but does on Windows.

Discovered in PowerShell repo https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/18469

### Reproduction Steps

1. Get `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value
2. Sleep/hibernate your notebook
3. Wait a while and wake up the notebook
4. Get `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value

### Expected behavior

`Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value takes into account the sleep time.

### Actual behavior

`Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value doesn't take into account the sleep time on Unix.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

Related code
https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/d320fd90a2976b388169dd51b3732ad01bcb4266/src/native/libs/System.Native/pal_time.c#L84-L97

uses `CLOCK_UPTIME_RAW` - the bug seems to be right here. Should it be `CLOCK_BOOTTIME`?

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @tommcdon See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
### Description `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` doesn't take into account suspend/sleep time on Unix but does on Windows. Discovered in PowerShell repo https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/18469 ### Reproduction Steps 1. Get `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value 2. Sleep/hibernate your notebook 3. Wait a while and wake up the notebook 4. Get `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value ### Expected behavior `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value takes into account the sleep time. ### Actual behavior `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value doesn't take into account the sleep time on Unix. ### Regression? _No response_ ### Known Workarounds _No response_ ### Configuration _No response_ ### Other information Related code https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/d320fd90a2976b388169dd51b3732ad01bcb4266/src/native/libs/System.Native/pal_time.c#L84-L97 uses `CLOCK_UPTIME_RAW` - the bug seems to be right here. Should it be `CLOCK_BOOTTIME`?
Author: iSazonov
Assignees: -
Labels: `area-System.Diagnostics`, `untriaged`
Milestone: -

issue.title: Add XxHash128

labels.name: community-contribution
labels.description: Indicates that the PR has been added by a community member

issue.body:
Fixes #77885

Lots of changes in XxHash3 because I had to extract a good chunk of the shared implementation for XXH3 to a shared class `XxHashShared`.

For large buffers, performance is on par with `XxHash3`, as it is using the shared implementation.
Compare to native, for intermediate buffers, I haven't checked XxHash3, but the performance is okish, but might require more optimizations here and there. I will try to add some of them as part of this PR If I find some (e.g see for example the `240` bytes buffer that is almost 6 times slower)

You will notice that I have introduced constants for all the secrets (e.g `DefaultSecretUInt64_0`), as they are shared between XXH3-64 and XXH3-128.

I have added similar tests to XxHash3, by using the native implementation to generate the expected test results.

This PR will have to wait for #77881 to be merged (and will have to be rebased, because XxHash3 file will conflict).

```
BenchmarkDotNet=v0.13.2, OS=Windows 11 (10.0.22621.674)
AMD Ryzen 9 5950X, 1 CPU, 32 logical and 16 physical cores
.NET SDK=7.0.100-rc.1.22431.12
  [Host]     : .NET 7.0.0 (7.0.22.42610), X64 RyuJIT AVX2
  DefaultJob : .NET 7.0.0 (7.0.22.42610), X64 RyuJIT AVX2
```

|----------- |-------------- |--------------:|-----------:|-----------:|
| XXH3Native |       Byte[0] |      7.137 ns |  0.0157 ns |  0.0147 ns |
|       XXH3 |       Byte[0] |     12.110 ns |  0.0894 ns |  0.0836 ns |
| XXH3Native | Byte[1048576] | 27,354.139 ns | 92.2719 ns | 86.3112 ns |
|       XXH3 | Byte[1048576] | 31,880.918 ns | 33.4602 ns | 31.2987 ns |
| XXH3Native |     Byte[128] |     10.459 ns |  0.0208 ns |  0.0184 ns |
|       XXH3 |     Byte[128] |     28.779 ns |  0.2224 ns |  0.1857 ns |
| XXH3Native |      Byte[16] |      7.715 ns |  0.0150 ns |  0.0140 ns |
|       XXH3 |      Byte[16] |     17.824 ns |  0.0928 ns |  0.0868 ns |
| XXH3Native |     Byte[240] |     21.043 ns |  0.0578 ns |  0.0512 ns |
|       XXH3 |     Byte[240] |    118.980 ns |  0.4931 ns |  0.4612 ns |
| XXH3Native |       Byte[3] |      7.745 ns |  0.0273 ns |  0.0255 ns |
|       XXH3 |       Byte[3] |     13.438 ns |  0.0067 ns |  0.0059 ns |
| XXH3Native |       Byte[8] |      7.286 ns |  0.0131 ns |  0.0122 ns |
|       XXH3 |       Byte[8] |     14.442 ns |  0.0680 ns |  0.0636 ns |

cc: @stephentoub, @EgorBo

issue.title: Don't use IsMatchingConst in Tier0

labels.name: area-CodeGen-coreclr
labels.description: CLR JIT compiler in src/coreclr/src/jit and related components such as SuperPMI

issue.body: According to flamegraphs, JIT spends quite a lot of time inside LSRA for Tier0. I noticed `isMatchingConstant` in the traces while in code it's already disabled for tier0 but still invoked.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs/pull/87542)

comment.body:
Hello @daraghk86,

During installation testing, this application failed to install without user input. Did you forget to add Silent or SilentWithProgress switches?

This can also happen when a dependency is missing. You can test with https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs#test-your-manifest.

Please investigate a fix and resubmit the Pull Request.

You may also try using the [Windows Package Manager Manifest Creator](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-create) to determine the proper installer type. If the installer type is MSIX, MSI, or a known installer technology like NullSoft, Inno, etc. the wingetcreate tool can detect them and the winget client will know what switches to pass. If it's a .exe installer of an unknown type, you will need to search to determine the proper switches for Silent and SilentWithProgress.

issue.title: inconsistent text under remarks

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

labels.name: Pri3
labels.description: Indicates issues/PRs that are low priority

issue.body:
https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/blob/main/xml/Microsoft.SqlServer.Server/SqlUserDefinedAggregateAttribute.xml

from article
Remarks
Reserved for future use. This property is not currently used by the query processor: order is currently not guaranteed.

Incorrectly setting this property can result in incorrect query results. This property is not an optimizer hint; it affects the plan selected and the results returned by the query.

The default value for this property is false.

A property cannot be "not in use" and at the same time have an effect on the results. That would imply it is used.

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @cheenamalhotra, @david-engel See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/blob/main/xml/Microsoft.SqlServer.Server/SqlUserDefinedAggregateAttribute.xml from article Remarks Reserved for future use. This property is not currently used by the query processor: order is currently not guaranteed. Incorrectly setting this property can result in incorrect query results. This property is not an optimizer hint; it affects the plan selected and the results returned by the query. The default value for this property is false. A property cannot be "not in use" and at the same time have an effect on the results. That would imply it is used.

issue.title: [Feature request] Add a generic pagination component to use with other components

labels.name: Needs: Author Feedback
labels.description: Issue needs response from issue author

issue.body: # Proposal: Add a pagination component `` to work with other components ## Description Currently , we have a bunch of amazing components like Agenda, People, Person, Tasks , Get etc. We are able to limit results in some of these components using `max-pages` property. But its an either/or scenario. We can either limit the results or get all results. There is no way, AFAIK, to display data in a paged manner. Please correct me if I am wrong. ## Rationale By addition of this feature, we can limit the amount of data over the wire. It will also open up possibilities to display data in a paged manner instead of limiting the result set. For example, show me the top 10 calendar events. Then I click on next button, it fetches me the next 10 events. Same could be the case with users. Show me 100 users, then click on next button, show me the next 100 users etc. ## Preferred Solution Something like this: ``` { //do something, like get next N items }} limiterIcon={"Emoji12"} /> ``` Basically a connection between , say `mgt-get` or `mgt-agenda` or `mgt-tasks` and `mgt-pagination` components so that we can display this data from Graph in a paged manner. ## Additional Context Something similar to PnP SPFx controls - https://pnp.github.io/sp-dev-fx-controls-react/controls/Pagination/ https://microsoft-search.github.io/pnp-modern-search/usage/search-results/common/paging/ We can also add `show-pagination` property to existing components ( Agenda, Tasks, People etc.) to display data in a paged manner. Please let me know if you need more information or anything else.

issue.title: [API Proposal]: Add 2 more constructors to ConcurrentDictionary class

labels.name: api-suggestion
labels.description: Early API idea and discussion, it is NOT ready for implementation

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @dotnet/area-system-collections See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
### Background and motivation The `System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary` type has the following constructor (among others) that has just one parameter, which allows to specify the initial dictionary capacity to help avoid reallocations and copying when the storage needs to grow: ```csharp public Dictionary (int capacity); ``` For some reason, if you want to use `System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary` and set the initial capacity, you need to use a constructor with 2 parameters: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity); ``` There is no constructor that only accepts `int capacity`. I always must specify this arcane `concurrencyLevel` parameter. We, as the framework users, don't know the default value of this parameter, because it is not documented, and we surely can assume that it may change in the future. Besides, we should not to worry about properly determining a correct concurrency level, when we only want to set the capacity. If we're unfortunate enough to specify a constant value there, the program will have the concurrency set improperly when running on a different machine - e.g. may have too many locks on only couple of cores, or not enough locks on a powerful machine. To fix the above and as an added benefit to make the API more consistent with `Dictionary` I propose to add two more constructors as shown below. ### API Proposal ```csharp namespace System.Collections.Concurrent; public class ConcurrentDictionary { public ConcurrentDictionary (int capacity); public ConcurrentDictionary (int capacity, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); } ``` ### API Usage ```csharp // I know that there will be more or less 1000 dictionary items and want to reduce reallocations/copying. // According to the docs, "the capacity should not be divisible by a small prime number", hence a prime here. var dict = new ConcurrentDictionary(1009); // Use the dictionary as usual. ``` ### Alternative Designs Alternative is to use the existing constructors: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity); public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); ``` and maintain the concurrency level at our side, perhaps providing there `Environment.ProcessorCount`. It is just extraneous and not clear. ### Risks This addition does not create a breaking change and is a really simple modification. There's no added maintenance burden, as the implicit concurrency level value is already used in some constructors (such as the default one). I assume that the constructors weren't implemented so far, because there are others taking just one `int` value, such as this: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable> collection, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); ``` and the API designer may had thought that it might have been confusing to have the first parameter sometimes meaning concurrency level, and other times the capacity. This is unwarranted, and benefits far outweigh this risk.
Author: Hermholtz
Assignees: -
Labels: `api-suggestion`, `area-System.Collections`, `untriaged`
Milestone: -

issue.title: [File Locksmith] does not identify locks from other logged in users

labels.name: Issue-Bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Needs-Triage
labels.description: For issues raised to be triaged and prioritized by internal Microsoft teams

issue.body:
### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.64.0

### Installation method

PowerToys auto-update

### Running as admin

Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

File Locksmith

### Steps to reproduce

 - logged in as user1
 - opened a PowerPoint file from a flash drive
 - verified I get error when trying to eject flash drive
 - stayed logged in as user1 and logged in as user2
 - tried to eject flash drive and got error saying device is in use (as expected)
 - right-clicked powerpoint file on flash drive currently opened by user1
 - chose "What's using this file?"
 - "no results"

### ✔️ Expected Behavior

when checking "What's using this file?", it should report that the file is locked by user1

### ❌ Actual Behavior

I get "no results" when logged in as user2. File Locksmith is not finding the file lock in place by user1

When I am on as user1 and use File Locksmith, and click the chevron for more details, it identifies that the user of the locked file is me (user1), which is why I assumed it would identify user1 as having a lock on the file when logged on as user2.

### Other Software

_No response_

issue.title: Match Application Insights schema when exporting

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: analytics
labels.description: Related to App Center's analytics service

labels.name: reviewed-DRI
labels.description: Reviewed by DRI

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
Custom events are exported to Application Insights (when connected via Export) but the data that reaches Application Insights does not match the schema used.  The mismatch results in more data being sent, which is invalid for non-mobile, and the custom event data in a sub-dictionary unlike AI.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
There are no exposed alternative solutions, the SDK needs modification.

**Additional context**
We are gathering analytics for Windows print drivers and desktop applications.  The use of the AppCenter SDK is to add analytics to the macOS print drivers. The Windows group is using the Microsoft provided Application Insights SDK and the data format it sends is the basis for the data queries already created.

The macOS AppCenter SDK, when exporting to Application Insights, uses a different schema than AI does.  The custom event data from AppCenter is put in root:customDimensions:properties and the custom event data from AI is in root:customDimensions.

In addition, AppCenter sends along fields that are mobile specific and/or empty.  We are sending data from a background process so screen size is always 0x0, is this useful data to send?  The Windows users generate 2 GB of data each day so sending non-useful fields is just wasted bytes.

Attached are 2 screenshots showing the difference in data between macOS and Windows.
![macos](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47667503/53810881-f64b9880-3f25-11e9-97c9-9f9571060cfd.png)
![windows](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47667503/53810882-f64b9880-3f25-11e9-9c14-b7b61b4aa90b.png)

issue.title: Add tag metadata to individual release in distribute model

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: distribute
labels.description: Related to App Center's Distribution service

issue.body: I would like to be able to tag a release in the distribute module. i.e. Release Candidate, Nightly, Automation, etc. It could help our teams easily filter through a bunch of releases. The only way to do this currently is to add the data in the release notes and have them manually check each release's notes before installing. Having it as a metadata could help quickly filter the data.

labels.description: This issue has been merged into main and deployed to canary.

issue.body:
This issue tracks tasks that would holistically improve support of shadow DOM in Accessibility Insights. We are pretty close but have some small improvements to make.

I made a tracking issue because it feels like there could be other areas of the tool I'm forgetting. For example, any fixes should also check assessment behavior. Happy to restructure or break out as requested.

At the moment, everything below is related to open (not closed) shadow DOM support.

### Current status
Automated checks supports open shadow DOM ([see FAQ](https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/web/reference/faq/#are-automated-checks-compatible-with-shadow-dom) added in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/issues/3768). We do not support closed Shadow DOM (expected). This is consistent with `axe-core`, which [added native open shadow DOM support in v3.0](https://github.com/dequelabs/axe-core/blob/develop/doc/developer-guide.md#axe-developer-guide).

Running automated checks on a webpage with open shadow elements results in a reasonable list of errors and automated report.

### Improvements

#### Visualization
Accessibility Insights for Web does not draw highlight boxes around elements inside open shadow DOMs. 

One example of this behavior for headings is here: https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/issues/5126 In this case, no highlight box is drawn at all.

`axe-core` provides a canonical way to find out whether a resulting node is in a shadow DOM: 
> If the item in the Array is an Array of strings, then it points to an element in a shadow DOM and each item (except the n-1th) in this array is a selector to a DOM element with a shadow DOM. The last element in the array points to the final shadow DOM node.

Our code (one example in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/blob/20a946b8d4bbf8fe098c1dddbde1e4348c417d91/src/injected/visualization/highlight-box-drawer.ts#L16) does not leverage this fact.

If we run automated checks on an element inside shadow DOM, the shadow root is highlighted instead of the child element.

#### Tab stops automation
Testing tab stops on pages with open shadow DOMs can have unexpected effects (see details & proposed fix in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/pull/5463#issuecomment-1122915346):
- Our tab-stop-listening code identifies the shadow root rather than a child node when focused. Therefore we produce many "keyboard trap" errors.
- I plan to merge the Tabbable update without opting in to shadow DOM support. We should opt into support separately and together with the other changes in this section.

### Examples to test against

This [CodePen](https://codepen.io/karansin/full/abqZXaL) is a modified version of shadow-doms.html Dan added in our repo.

### other details
Version 2.32.0
Chrome Version 101.0.4951.54 (Official Build) (32-bit)
Windows 19044.1645

issue.body:
## Describe the bug

Deploying custom roles module on a new hierarchy under the same tenant (e.g. canary) goes in conflict with other existing hierarchy. This is expected since role definition name (guid) is calculated from the descriptive name, for example _Network management (NetOps)_ in [/infra-as-code/bicep/modules/customRoleDefinitions/definitions/cafNetworkManagementRole.bicep](https://github.com/Azure/ALZ-Bicep/blob/main/infra-as-code/bicep/modules/customRoleDefinitions/definitions/cafNetworkManagementRole.bicep#:~:text=var%20varRole%20%3D%20%7B,.name).

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behaviour:

1. deploy till Custom Role Definitions module under a top parent management group with id XXX
2. deploy till Custom Role Definitions module under a top parent management group with id YYY

## Expected behaviour

Custom role definition name should be generated using top parent management group id too.

## Correlation ID

issue.title: Setting linuxFxVersion has no effect on the host runtime version
issue.body:
<!-- 
Please provide a succinct description of the issue. Please make an effort to fill in the all the sections below or we may close your issue for being low quality. 
-->

#### Investigative information


- Timestamp: 2022-15-06
- Function App version: 4.3.2.2
- Invocation ID: N/A
- Region: North Europe

<!-- 
If you don't want to share your Function App name or Functions names on GitHub, please be sure to provide your Invocation ID, Timestamp, and Region - we can use this to look up your Function App/Function. Provide an invocation id per Function. See the [wiki](https://github.com/Azure/azure-webjobs-sdk-script/wiki/Sharing-Your-Function-App-name-privately) for more details. 
-->

#### Repro steps

Provide the steps required to reproduce the problem:

<!--
Example: 

1. Step A
2. Step B
-->

1. Create an Azure function on linux consumption plan with dotnet 6
2. Run `az functionapp config show`, linuxFxVersion is set to "DOTNET|6.0"
3. Run `az functionapp config set` to set the version to `DOCKER|mcr.microsoft.com/azure-functions/mesh:4.5.2` (as described [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/set-runtime-version?tabs=azurecli#manual-version-updates-on-linux))
4. Run `az functionapp config show`, linuxFxVersion is set to the new value
5. Wait until the Azure Function restarts and check the host startup logs (that are collected e.g. via diagnostics).

#### Expected behavior

I expected that the version of the host would be 4.5.2.x in this case but it does not seem to be the case. 

<!--
Example:

 - After I perform step B, the lights in the house should turn off.
-->

#### Actual behavior

This is what is shown in the logs (hostVersion of all subsequent logs is set to 4.3.2.2 as well):

> Starting Host (HostId=<id>, InstanceId=<id>, Version=4.3.2.2, ProcessId=72, AppDomainId=1, InDebugMode=False, InDiagnosticMode=False, FunctionsExtensionVersion=~4)


<!--
Example:

- Step B actually causes my cat to meow for some reason.
-->

#### Known workarounds

Unknown

<!--
Example:

- Turn off the circuit breaker for the lights.
-->

#### Related information 

I have tried to use node versions of docker image an my C# application still runs, so it seems the version that I set has no effect.

issue.title: [BUG] Unable to deploy new AKS cluster with windows nodes using bicep, since docker is no longer supported
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Bicep deployment fails when creating a aks cluster with a windows node pool. Windows nodepools no longer support docker (since kubernetes version 1.24). It is not possible to deploy a new nodepool using Bicep because setting the customheader is not possible.

Since bicep is a layer above ARM, it probably also fails when using plain ARM.

**To Reproduce**
Deploy a AKS cluster using Bicep, with the follwing windows nodepool. Notice the error that the custom header is not supported. Without aksCustomHeaders you will the error that docker is no longer supported.
```
      {
        name: 'akswin1'
        orchestratorVersion: 1.24.3
        count: 2
        mode: 'User'
        osType: 'Windows'
        type: 'VirtualMachineScaleSets'
        vmSize: windowsPoolVmSize
        enableFIPS:   false
        osDiskSizeGB: 128
        aksCustomHeaders: 'WindowsContainerRuntime=containerd'
      }
```

**Expected behavior**
Since containerd is the default, the cluster should deploy without error. The validation seems incorrect to me.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Bicep version 0.11.1 
 - CLI Version 2.38.0
 - Kubernetes version 1.24.3

**Additional context**
Upgrading an existing cluster works fine. The workaround is to deploy an older version of kubernetes first. This will default to containerd. Then upgrade to 1.24.3. This only works until version 1.23 is supported.

issue.title: Vectorize String.Equals for OrdinalIgnoreCase

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @dotnet/area-system-globalization See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
I tried to keep it simple so no AVX fallback + scalar path for trailing elements. Benchmark: ```csharp [Benchmark] [ArgumentsSource(nameof(TestData))] public bool EqualsIgnoreCase(string s1, string s2) => s1.Equals(s2, StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase); public static IEnumerable TestData() { yield return new object[] { @"Hi!", // 3 chars (to make sure overhead is not big) @"HI!", }; yield return new object[] { @"hello!!!", // 8 chars (switches to SIMD) @"HELLO!!!", }; yield return new object[] { @"hello world", // 11 chars (1 simd + trailing elements) @"HELLO WORLD", }; yield return new object[] { @"C:\prj\runtime-main\src\coreclr\CMakeLists.txt", @"C:\prj\runtime-main\src\CORECLR\CMakeLists.txt", }; yield return new object[] { @"Good bug reports make it easier for maintainers to verify and root cause the underlying problem. The better a bug report, the faster the problem will be resolved. Ideally, a bug report should contain the following information:", // 226 chars @"GOOD bug reports make it easier for maintainers to verify and root cause the underlying problem. The better a bug report, the faster the problem will be resolved. Ideally, a bug report should contain the following information:", }; } ``` | Method | Toolchain | s1 | s2 | Mean | |----------------- |---------------------------- |--------------------- |--------------------- |----------:| | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | Hi! | HI! | 2.940 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | Hi! | HI! | 2.901 ns | | | | | | | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | hello!!! | HELLO!!! | 4.898 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | hello!!! | HELLO!!! | 4.829 ns | | | | | | | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | hello world | HELLO WORLD | 5.880 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | hello world | HELLO WORLD | 6.143 ns | | | | | | | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | C:\pr(...)s.txt [46] | C:\pr(...)s.txt [46] | 11.422 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | C:\pr(...)s.txt [46] | C:\pr(...)s.txt [46] | 19.049 ns | | | | | | | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root\corerun.exe | Good(...)ion: [226] | GOOD(...)ion: [226] | 40.289 ns | | EqualsIgnoreCase | \Core_Root_base\corerun.exe | Good(...)ion: [226] | GOOD(...)ion: [226] | 86.035 ns | I expect better difference on ARM64 where the scalar (SWAR) path suffers from 64bit constants everywhere.

issue.title: Stopwatch.GetTimestamp() doesn't take into account sleep time on Unix

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

issue.body:
### Description

`Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` doesn't take into account suspend/sleep time on Unix but does on Windows.

Discovered in PowerShell repo https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/18469

### Reproduction Steps

1. Get `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value
2. Sleep/hibernate your notebook
3. Wait a while and wake up the notebook
4. Get `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value

### Expected behavior

`Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value takes into account the sleep time.

### Actual behavior

`Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()` value doesn't take into account the sleep time on Unix.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

Related code
https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/d320fd90a2976b388169dd51b3732ad01bcb4266/src/native/libs/System.Native/pal_time.c#L84-L97

uses `CLOCK_UPTIME_RAW` - the bug seems to be right here. Should it be `CLOCK_BOOTTIME`?

issue.title: Add XxHash128

labels.name: community-contribution
labels.description: Indicates that the PR has been added by a community member

issue.body:
Fixes #77885

Lots of changes in XxHash3 because I had to extract a good chunk of the shared implementation for XXH3 to a shared class `XxHashShared`.

For large buffers, performance is on par with `XxHash3`, as it is using the shared implementation.
Compare to native, for intermediate buffers, I haven't checked XxHash3, but the performance is okish, but might require more optimizations here and there. I will try to add some of them as part of this PR If I find some (e.g see for example the `240` bytes buffer that is almost 6 times slower)

You will notice that I have introduced constants for all the secrets (e.g `DefaultSecretUInt64_0`), as they are shared between XXH3-64 and XXH3-128.

I have added similar tests to XxHash3, by using the native implementation to generate the expected test results.

This PR will have to wait for #77881 to be merged (and will have to be rebased, because XxHash3 file will conflict).

```
BenchmarkDotNet=v0.13.2, OS=Windows 11 (10.0.22621.674)
AMD Ryzen 9 5950X, 1 CPU, 32 logical and 16 physical cores
.NET SDK=7.0.100-rc.1.22431.12
  [Host]     : .NET 7.0.0 (7.0.22.42610), X64 RyuJIT AVX2
  DefaultJob : .NET 7.0.0 (7.0.22.42610), X64 RyuJIT AVX2
```

|     Method |          data |          Mean |      Error |     StdDev |
|----------- |-------------- |--------------:|-----------:|-----------:|
| XXH3Native |       Byte[0] |      7.137 ns |  0.0157 ns |  0.0147 ns |
|       XXH3 |       Byte[0] |     12.110 ns |  0.0894 ns |  0.0836 ns |
| XXH3Native | Byte[1048576] | 27,354.139 ns | 92.2719 ns | 86.3112 ns |
|       XXH3 | Byte[1048576] | 31,880.918 ns | 33.4602 ns | 31.2987 ns |
| XXH3Native |     Byte[128] |     10.459 ns |  0.0208 ns |  0.0184 ns |
|       XXH3 |     Byte[128] |     28.779 ns |  0.2224 ns |  0.1857 ns |
| XXH3Native |      Byte[16] |      7.715 ns |  0.0150 ns |  0.0140 ns |
|       XXH3 |      Byte[16] |     17.824 ns |  0.0928 ns |  0.0868 ns |
| XXH3Native |     Byte[240] |     21.043 ns |  0.0578 ns |  0.0512 ns |
|       XXH3 |     Byte[240] |    118.980 ns |  0.4931 ns |  0.4612 ns |
| XXH3Native |       Byte[3] |      7.745 ns |  0.0273 ns |  0.0255 ns |
|       XXH3 |       Byte[3] |     13.438 ns |  0.0067 ns |  0.0059 ns |
| XXH3Native |       Byte[8] |      7.286 ns |  0.0131 ns |  0.0122 ns |
|       XXH3 |       Byte[8] |     14.442 ns |  0.0680 ns |  0.0636 ns |

cc: @stephentoub, @EgorBo

comment.body:

comment.body:
Hello @daraghk86,

During installation testing, this application failed to install without user input. Did you forget to add Silent or SilentWithProgress switches?

This can also happen when a dependency is missing. You can test with https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs#test-your-manifest.

Please investigate a fix and resubmit the Pull Request.

You may also try using the [Windows Package Manager Manifest Creator](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-create) to determine the proper installer type. If the installer type is MSIX, MSI, or a known installer technology like NullSoft, Inno, etc. the wingetcreate tool can detect them and the winget client will know what switches to pass. If it's a .exe installer of an unknown type, you will need to search to determine the proper switches for Silent and SilentWithProgress.

issue.title: inconsistent text under remarks

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

labels.name: Pri3
labels.description: Indicates issues/PRs that are low priority

issue.body:
https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/blob/main/xml/Microsoft.SqlServer.Server/SqlUserDefinedAggregateAttribute.xml

from article
Remarks
Reserved for future use. This property is not currently used by the query processor: order is currently not guaranteed.

Incorrectly setting this property can result in incorrect query results. This property is not an optimizer hint; it affects the plan selected and the results returned by the query.

The default value for this property is false.

A property cannot be "not in use" and at the same time have an effect on the results. That would imply it is used.

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @cheenamalhotra, @david-engel See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/blob/main/xml/Microsoft.SqlServer.Server/SqlUserDefinedAggregateAttribute.xml from article Remarks Reserved for future use. This property is not currently used by the query processor: order is currently not guaranteed. Incorrectly setting this property can result in incorrect query results. This property is not an optimizer hint; it affects the plan selected and the results returned by the query. The default value for this property is false. A property cannot be "not in use" and at the same time have an effect on the results. That would imply it is used.
Author: bzuidgeest
Assignees: -
Labels: `untriaged`, `Pri3`, `area-System.Data.SqlClient`
Milestone: -

issue.title: Regressions in System.Buffers.Text.Tests.Utf8FormatterTests

labels.name: tenet-performance
labels.description: Performance related issue

labels.name: tenet-performance-benchmarks
labels.description: Issue from performance benchmark

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

issue.body:
### Regressions in System.Buffers.Text.Tests.Utf8FormatterTests

Benchmark | Baseline | Test | Test/Base | Test Quality | Edge Detector | Baseline IR | Compare IR | IR Ratio | Baseline ETL | Compare ETL

issue.title: [Feature request] Add a generic pagination component to use with other components

labels.name: Needs: Author Feedback
labels.description: Issue needs response from issue author

issue.body: # Proposal: Add a pagination component `` to work with other components ## Description Currently , we have a bunch of amazing components like Agenda, People, Person, Tasks , Get etc. We are able to limit results in some of these components using `max-pages` property. But its an either/or scenario. We can either limit the results or get all results. There is no way, AFAIK, to display data in a paged manner. Please correct me if I am wrong. ## Rationale By addition of this feature, we can limit the amount of data over the wire. It will also open up possibilities to display data in a paged manner instead of limiting the result set. For example, show me the top 10 calendar events. Then I click on next button, it fetches me the next 10 events. Same could be the case with users. Show me 100 users, then click on next button, show me the next 100 users etc. ## Preferred Solution Something like this: ``` { //do something, like get next N items }} limiterIcon={"Emoji12"} /> ``` Basically a connection between , say `mgt-get` or `mgt-agenda` or `mgt-tasks` and `mgt-pagination` components so that we can display this data from Graph in a paged manner. ## Additional Context Something similar to PnP SPFx controls - https://pnp.github.io/sp-dev-fx-controls-react/controls/Pagination/ https://microsoft-search.github.io/pnp-modern-search/usage/search-results/common/paging/ We can also add `show-pagination` property to existing components ( Agenda, Tasks, People etc.) to display data in a paged manner. Please let me know if you need more information or anything else.

issue.title: [API Proposal]: Add 2 more constructors to ConcurrentDictionary class

labels.name: api-suggestion
labels.description: Early API idea and discussion, it is NOT ready for implementation

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: New issue has not been triaged by the area owner

comment.body:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @dotnet/area-system-collections See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
### Background and motivation The `System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary` type has the following constructor (among others) that has just one parameter, which allows to specify the initial dictionary capacity to help avoid reallocations and copying when the storage needs to grow: ```csharp public Dictionary (int capacity); ``` For some reason, if you want to use `System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary` and set the initial capacity, you need to use a constructor with 2 parameters: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity); ``` There is no constructor that only accepts `int capacity`. I always must specify this arcane `concurrencyLevel` parameter. We, as the framework users, don't know the default value of this parameter, because it is not documented, and we surely can assume that it may change in the future. Besides, we should not to worry about properly determining a correct concurrency level, when we only want to set the capacity. If we're unfortunate enough to specify a constant value there, the program will have the concurrency set improperly when running on a different machine - e.g. may have too many locks on only couple of cores, or not enough locks on a powerful machine. To fix the above and as an added benefit to make the API more consistent with `Dictionary` I propose to add two more constructors as shown below. ### API Proposal ```csharp namespace System.Collections.Concurrent; public class ConcurrentDictionary { public ConcurrentDictionary (int capacity); public ConcurrentDictionary (int capacity, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); } ``` ### API Usage ```csharp // I know that there will be more or less 1000 dictionary items and want to reduce reallocations/copying. // According to the docs, "the capacity should not be divisible by a small prime number", hence a prime here. var dict = new ConcurrentDictionary(1009); // Use the dictionary as usual. ``` ### Alternative Designs Alternative is to use the existing constructors: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity); public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, int capacity, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); ``` and maintain the concurrency level at our side, perhaps providing there `Environment.ProcessorCount`. It is just extraneous and not clear. ### Risks This addition does not create a breaking change and is a really simple modification. There's no added maintenance burden, as the implicit concurrency level value is already used in some constructors (such as the default one). I assume that the constructors weren't implemented so far, because there are others taking just one `int` value, such as this: ```csharp public ConcurrentDictionary (int concurrencyLevel, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable> collection, System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer? comparer); ``` and the API designer may had thought that it might have been confusing to have the first parameter sometimes meaning concurrency level, and other times the capacity. This is unwarranted, and benefits far outweigh this risk.
Author: Hermholtz
Assignees: -
Labels: `api-suggestion`, `area-System.Collections`, `untriaged`
Milestone: -

issue.title: [File Locksmith] does not identify locks from other logged in users

labels.name: Issue-Bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Needs-Triage
labels.description: For issues raised to be triaged and prioritized by internal Microsoft teams

issue.body:
### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.64.0

### Installation method

PowerToys auto-update

### Running as admin

Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

File Locksmith

### Steps to reproduce

 - logged in as user1
 - opened a PowerPoint file from a flash drive
 - verified I get error when trying to eject flash drive
 - stayed logged in as user1 and logged in as user2
 - tried to eject flash drive and got error saying device is in use (as expected)
 - right-clicked powerpoint file on flash drive currently opened by user1
 - chose "What's using this file?"
 - "no results"

### ✔️ Expected Behavior

when checking "What's using this file?", it should report that the file is locked by user1

### ❌ Actual Behavior

I get "no results" when logged in as user2. File Locksmith is not finding the file lock in place by user1

When I am on as user1 and use File Locksmith, and click the chevron for more details, it identifies that the user of the locked file is me (user1), which is why I assumed it would identify user1 as having a lock on the file when logged on as user2.

### Other Software

_No response_

issue.title: Match Application Insights schema when exporting

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: analytics
labels.description: Related to App Center's analytics service

labels.name: reviewed-DRI
labels.description: Reviewed by DRI

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
Custom events are exported to Application Insights (when connected via Export) but the data that reaches Application Insights does not match the schema used.  The mismatch results in more data being sent, which is invalid for non-mobile, and the custom event data in a sub-dictionary unlike AI.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
There are no exposed alternative solutions, the SDK needs modification.

**Additional context**
We are gathering analytics for Windows print drivers and desktop applications.  The use of the AppCenter SDK is to add analytics to the macOS print drivers. The Windows group is using the Microsoft provided Application Insights SDK and the data format it sends is the basis for the data queries already created.

The macOS AppCenter SDK, when exporting to Application Insights, uses a different schema than AI does.  The custom event data from AppCenter is put in root:customDimensions:properties and the custom event data from AI is in root:customDimensions.

In addition, AppCenter sends along fields that are mobile specific and/or empty.  We are sending data from a background process so screen size is always 0x0, is this useful data to send?  The Windows users generate 2 GB of data each day so sending non-useful fields is just wasted bytes.

Attached are 2 screenshots showing the difference in data between macOS and Windows.
![macos](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47667503/53810881-f64b9880-3f25-11e9-97c9-9f9571060cfd.png)
![windows](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47667503/53810882-f64b9880-3f25-11e9-9c14-b7b61b4aa90b.png)

Having it as a metadata could help quickly filter the data.

issue.title: Improve shadow DOM support (visualizations & tab stops automation)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: status: needs author feedback
labels.description: This issue requires additional information from the issue author.

labels.name: status: no recent activity
labels.description: This issue requires additional information from the author, but hasn't been updated recently.

labels.name: status: resolved
labels.description: This issue has been merged into main and deployed to canary.

issue.body:
This issue tracks tasks that would holistically improve support of shadow DOM in Accessibility Insights. We are pretty close but have some small improvements to make.

I made a tracking issue because it feels like there could be other areas of the tool I'm forgetting. For example, any fixes should also check assessment behavior. Happy to restructure or break out as requested.

At the moment, everything below is related to open (not closed) shadow DOM support.

### Current status
Automated checks supports open shadow DOM ([see FAQ](https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/web/reference/faq/#are-automated-checks-compatible-with-shadow-dom) added in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/issues/3768). We do not support closed Shadow DOM (expected). This is consistent with `axe-core`, which [added native open shadow DOM support in v3.0](https://github.com/dequelabs/axe-core/blob/develop/doc/developer-guide.md#axe-developer-guide).

Running automated checks on a webpage with open shadow elements results in a reasonable list of errors and automated report.

### Improvements

#### Visualization
Accessibility Insights for Web does not draw highlight boxes around elements inside open shadow DOMs. 

One example of this behavior for headings is here: https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/issues/5126 In this case, no highlight box is drawn at all.

`axe-core` provides a canonical way to find out whether a resulting node is in a shadow DOM: 
> If the item in the Array is an Array of strings, then it points to an element in a shadow DOM and each item (except the n-1th) in this array is a selector to a DOM element with a shadow DOM. The last element in the array points to the final shadow DOM node.

Our code (one example in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/blob/20a946b8d4bbf8fe098c1dddbde1e4348c417d91/src/injected/visualization/highlight-box-drawer.ts#L16) does not leverage this fact.

If we run automated checks on an element inside shadow DOM, the shadow root is highlighted instead of the child element.

#### Tab stops automation
Testing tab stops on pages with open shadow DOMs can have unexpected effects (see details & proposed fix in https://github.com/microsoft/accessibility-insights-web/pull/5463#issuecomment-1122915346):
- Our tab-stop-listening code identifies the shadow root rather than a child node when focused. Therefore we produce many "keyboard trap" errors.
- I plan to merge the Tabbable update without opting in to shadow DOM support. We should opt into support separately and together with the other changes in this section.

### Examples to test against

This [CodePen](https://codepen.io/karansin/full/abqZXaL) is a modified version of shadow-doms.html Dan added in our repo.

### other details
Version 2.32.0
Chrome Version 101.0.4951.54 (Official Build) (32-bit)
Windows 19044.1645

issue.title: Bug: Color samples in issues dialog are overridden in HC modes

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: status: needs author feedback
labels.description: This issue requires additional information from the issue author.

labels.name: status: no recent activity
labels.description: This issue requires additional information from the author, but hasn't been updated recently.

labels.name: status: resolved
labels.description: This issue has been merged into main and deployed to canary.

issue.body: ## Describe the bug Not sure if this is intentional, but filing for completeness. For a color contrast issue, we display colors both as a numeric value and as a color sample. Here's a screenshot of what I mean--notice that the displayed colors and the textual colors stay in sync: Here's the same dialog, using WIn 10's High Contrast Black theme--the textual colors are unchanged from before, but the color samples have been forced to the HC themes. As a result, the textual description and the color sample are now out of sync with each other: **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to any page with a contrast issue 2. Run automated checks 3. Open the issues dialog for one of the contrast issues 4. Switch between HC and non-HC modes. ## To Reproduce

1. deploy till Custom Role Definitions module under a top parent management group with id XXX

issue.title: Setting linuxFxVersion has no effect on the host runtime version
issue.body:
<!-- 
Please provide a succinct description of the issue. Please make an effort to fill in the all the sections below or we may close your issue for being low quality. 
-->

#### Investigative information


- Timestamp: 2022-15-06
- Function App version: 4.3.2.2
- Invocation ID: N/A
- Region: North Europe

<!-- 
If you don't want to share your Function App name or Functions names on GitHub, please be sure to provide your Invocation ID, Timestamp, and Region - we can use this to look up your Function App/Function. Provide an invocation id per Function. See the [wiki](https://github.com/Azure/azure-webjobs-sdk-script/wiki/Sharing-Your-Function-App-name-privately) for more details. 
-->

#### Repro steps

Provide the steps required to reproduce the problem:

<!--
Example: 

1. Step A
2. Step B
-->

1. Create an Azure function on linux consumption plan with dotnet 6
2. Run `az functionapp config show`, linuxFxVersion is set to "DOTNET|6.0"
3. Run `az functionapp config set` to set the version to `DOCKER|mcr.microsoft.com/azure-functions/mesh:4.5.2` (as described [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/set-runtime-version?tabs=azurecli#manual-version-updates-on-linux))
4. Run `az functionapp config show`, linuxFxVersion is set to the new value
5. Wait until the Azure Function restarts and check the host startup logs (that are collected e.g. via diagnostics).

#### Expected behavior

I expected that the version of the host would be 4.5.2.x in this case but it does not seem to be the case. 

<!--
Example:

 - After I perform step B, the lights in the house should turn off.
-->

#### Actual behavior

This is what is shown in the logs (hostVersion of all subsequent logs is set to 4.3.2.2 as well):

> Starting Host (HostId=<id>, InstanceId=<id>, Version=4.3.2.2, ProcessId=72, AppDomainId=1, InDebugMode=False, InDiagnosticMode=False, FunctionsExtensionVersion=~4)


<!--
Example:

- Step B actually causes my cat to meow for some reason.
-->

#### Known workarounds

Unknown

<!--
Example:

- Turn off the circuit breaker for the lights.
-->

#### Related information 

I have tried to use node versions of docker image an my C# application still runs, so it seems the version that I set has no effect.

issue.title: [BUG] Unable to deploy new AKS cluster with windows nodes using bicep, since docker is no longer supported
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Bicep deployment fails when creating a aks cluster with a windows node pool. Windows nodepools no longer support docker (since kubernetes version 1.24). It is not possible to deploy a new nodepool using Bicep because setting the customheader is not possible.

Since bicep is a layer above ARM, it probably also fails when using plain ARM.

**To Reproduce**
Deploy a AKS cluster using Bicep, with the follwing windows nodepool. Notice the error that the custom header is not supported. Without aksCustomHeaders you will the error that docker is no longer supported.
```
      {
        name: 'akswin1'
        orchestratorVersion: 1.24.3
        count: 2
        mode: 'User'
        osType: 'Windows'
        type: 'VirtualMachineScaleSets'
        vmSize: windowsPoolVmSize
        enableFIPS:   false
        osDiskSizeGB: 128
        aksCustomHeaders: 'WindowsContainerRuntime=containerd'
      }
```

**Expected behavior**
Since containerd is the default, the cluster should deploy without error. The validation seems incorrect to me.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Bicep version 0.11.1 
 - CLI Version 2.38.0
 - Kubernetes version 1.24.3

**Additional context**
Upgrading an existing cluster works fine. The workaround is to deploy an older version of kubernetes first. This will default to containerd. Then upgrade to 1.24.3. This only works until version 1.23 is supported.
